title: Which is better after B.SC BZC? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the “best career” after BSc BZC (which I hope is Botany, Zoology and Chemistry) is subjective to your interest. One of the career options (and the most lucrative) available is of course Research. To pursue this path, you can apply for Masters programmes in top institutes in India and then try and apply for a PhD in a decent university abroad. You are also eligible to apply for the Indian Forest Services, thats another lucrative option. If you follow your bachelors up with a Masters, you will also be eligible to apply for various vacancies announced by UPSC where the recruitments are directly made by UPSC itself to very good positions in the Government, where eligibility clearly seeks graduates in Chemistry etc.! You can also share your knowledge by entering into the field of teaching Or like any other graduate you have an option for preparing for CAT and getting into an IIM

Yes, you can do following courses after completing your B. Sc. With Botany, Chemistry n Zoology. You can go for M. Sc. (Chemistry) with any of the specialization in Organic, Inorganic, Industrial, Analytical, Physical, Nuclear Chemistry. Or you can opt for M. Sc. (Zoology) with any specialization. Or you can opt for M. Sc. (Botany) with the choice of your specializations.
